com.agsw.FabricView.DrawableObjects

Class CDrawable

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.agsw.FabricView.DrawableObjects.CDrawable
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CBitmap, CPath, CText, CTransform

    public abstract class CDrawable
extends java.lang.Object
    Created by antwan on 10/3/2015. This is the base class for all visible objects and transforms. It is at the top of the whole hierarchy for this library. CDrawables exist on a stack with the newer ones at the top. They can represent either visible objects or transforms of these objects. A transforms is stored the same as a visible object because they can both be undone. In other terms, the stack of CDrawables is the basis of the undo() and redo() methods.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      CDrawable()

      If you call this constructor, you HAVE to call setHeight() and setWidth().

    • Constructor Detail

      • CDrawable

        public CDrawable()
        If you call this constructor, you MUST call setXCoord(), setYCoord(), setHeight(), setWidth() and setPaint().

      • CDrawable

        public CDrawable(int x,
                 int y,
                 android.graphics.Paint paint)
        If you call this constructor, you HAVE to call setHeight() and setWidth().
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate where the object will be drawn.
        y - The Y coordinate where the object will be drawn.
        paint - The style and color to paint this object.

      • draw

        public abstract void draw(android.graphics.Canvas canvas)
        This function is used to draw the current object on the canvas. Subclasses must implement it.
        Parameters:
        canvas - The canvas to draw on.

      • computeBounds

        public android.graphics.Rect computeBounds()
        Calculates the bounds of this object. Takes into consideration all the transforms attached to it.
        Returns:
        The position of this object on the canvas.

      • hasTransforms

        public boolean hasTransforms()
        Returns:
        true if this object has transforms attached to it.

      • removeTransform

        public void removeTransform(CTransform transform)
        Cancels a transform. Be careful as all other transforms are still on the stack. This can produce weird results if you don't start from the top of the stack.
        Parameters:
        transform - The transform to cancel.

      • addTransform

        public void addTransform(CTransform transform)
        Adds a transform to this object, at the top of the stack.
        Parameters:
        transform - The transform to add.

      • getTransforms

        public java.util.List<CTransform> getTransforms()
